channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024021734
item.description:
Report X-2024021734

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box with gasoline odor found on loadside. No DOT Class 3 or Ltd Qty label, no UN number or Proper Shipping Name marked on packaging, no hazmat paperwork attached. Package transferred to HMPA for reporting. DescribePack: One partially disassembled 61lb Hoover Heart Gas Mini Chopper Bike, Model DB004 within package. This model has a 0.79 gallon capacity gas tank. It lost 0.2 gallon of gas due to a loose cap closure on the gas tank. Inadequate preparation for transportation. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2024021787
item.description:
Report X-2024021787

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-06T18:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: KINGSPORT
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Trailer was being unloaded when package handlers noticed the leaking hazmat. The area was cleared and management obtained the package and relocated it to the hazmat cage. Upon inspection I found two 2.5L bottles of hydrochloric acid both having loose caps causing internal leakage. DescribePack: Loose closures allowing some content to spill DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: We tightened loose caps.

item.title: Report X-2024021864
item.description:
Report X-2024021864

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE DISCOVERED LEAKING WHILE UNLOADING. PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN PLASTIC TOTE AND TAKEN TO QA DescribePack: AFTER INSPECTION, IT WAS FOUND THAT ALL 4 CAPS WERE LOOSE AND THE INNER FOIL SEALS WERE RUPTURED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN PLASTIC TOTE. AFTER INSPECTION, ALL 4 CAPS WERE TIGHTENED, BOX AIR DRIED.

item.title: Report X-2024021272
item.description:
Report X-2024021272

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-03
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 3rd, a package was found during the PM sort that was leaking a black liquid from the bottom. The package contained UN3265, CORROSIVE LIQUID, ACIDIC, ORGANIC, N.O.S., 8, II. the inner receptacle shattered allowing all contents to leak out. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2024021245
item.description:
Report X-2024021245

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-04
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 02/4/2024 at approximately 1030, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 658069 at the hub facilty in Memphis, reporting a corrosive spill. The shipment consisted of one plastic jerrican. A small hole was discovered at the bottom of the drum, resulting in spillage. drum was placed in a steel salvage package and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024021411
item.description:
Report X-2024021411

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UNPOP IS FULLY OBSCURED BY BARCODE. PACKAGING HAS NO "OVERPACK" OR "INNER PACKAGES COMPLY WITH PRESCRIBED SPECIFICATIONS" LABELS/MARKINGS. HAZMAT PACKAGE IS NON-COMPLIANT AND DID NOT RECEIVE A 97 (HAP FAILURE) AT ORIGIN MESQ. PLEASE NOTE THIS INCIDENT HAS BEEN ENTERED AS UNPROCESSED AT DISCOVERY FACILITY NASH. PLEASE ADVISE IF 49 CFR 178.3(a)(1) AND 49 CFR 178.503(a) AND 49 CFR 178.503(f) NO LONGER APPLY. Leaking, dented, torn fiberboard box (max capacity 4x1 gallon) with hazmat paperwork, and DOT Class 8 Label removed from operations and taken to HMPA. DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.1 gallon of fluid from excess weight applied to package, resulting in dent and pinhole puncture to body. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2024021405
item.description:
Report X-2024021405

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found inside trailer 569390 that came from ELOU at 12:45am. Upon Inspection box was loaded upside down leaking isopropyl alcohol caused by a punctured seal and loose cap causing internal leakage. DescribePack: one of the seals was punctured and loose cap on one of the gallon containers. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA identified the leaking hazmat package and immediately responded with appropriate materials and procedures to mitigate release.

Report X-2024030001

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A plastic jerrycan was dropped during the loading process at the MEMH facility. The jerrycan struck the edge of the catwalk causing a puncture on the bottom. It was placed into steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024020523
item.description:
Report E-2024020523

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS regarding (2) torn/punctured bags containing (UN1749) hazardous product. Approximately 1-gallon of product released onto the concrete dock floor. A Contractor cleaned the release and containerized the damaged product for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the spill.

item.title: Report X-2024021457
item.description:
Report X-2024021457

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-16
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat shipped as fully regulated. Leaking, torn fiberboard box transferred to HMPA staging pallet for reporting. Two additional Ecolab hazmat packages (TRK 270953931151 and TRK 270953931173) appear to be impacted by spillage from this incident; all three contain the same material. UNPOP RATING IS FULLY OBSCURED BY BARCODE. PACKAGING HAS NO "OVERPACK" OR "INNER PACKAGES COMPLY WITH PRESCRIBED SPECIFICATIONS" LABELS/MARKINGS. HAZMAT PACKAGE IS NON-COMPLIANT AND DID NOT RECEIVE A 97 (HAP FAILURE) AT ORIGIN MESQ. PLEASE NOTE THIS INCIDENT HAS BEEN ENTERED AS UNPROCESSED AT DISCOVERY FACILITY NASH. PLEASE ADVISE IF 49 CFR 178.3(a)(1) AND 49 CFR 178.503(a) AND 49 CFR 178.503(f) NO LONGER APPLY. DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.6 gallon in fluid due to a puncture scarcely 0.25" in size; Caused by impact with an unknown sharp object. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2024021239
item.description:
Report X-2024021239

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RETURN SERVICE PACKAGE FROM USA TO GERMANY WAS INSPECTED FOR AN INVOICE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED AN INNER BOX WITH A UN3481 LITHIUM-ION BATTERY MARKING. THERE ARE FIVE MOTO G9/LENOVO K12 CELL PHONES WITH ERT ECOA HANDHELD POWERED BY LITHIUM ION BATTERIES INSIDE THE BOX. THE PACKAGE ALSO CONTAINED ONE CLARIO TABLET POWERED BY A LITHIUM ION BATTERY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM TENNESSEE USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 4A2199, ERT ERESEARCH TECHNOLOGY GMBH, 3 SIEBOLDSTRASSE, ESTENFELD GERMANY 97230.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came down the chute open and busted open, QA was called to pick up the mess, QA put the package in a plastic bag and a black tote to bring to the hazmat processing area. DescribePack: Broken lids and improper shipment through the building. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: absorbent clean up and putting the package in a plastic bag and black tote.

item.title: Report E-2024020519
item.description:
Report E-2024020519

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-19
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 19, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 had faulty packaging and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. MSES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN1263-impacted dock door floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024021208
item.description:
Report X-2024021208

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon unloading of package it was found wet and leaking. It was placed in plastic bag and hazmat tote and brought to hazmat cage for further investigation. Once opened it was determined that one of the closures failed on one of the bottles causing the leak and internal damage to the package. DescribePack: Closures on the bottles were compromised causing internal leaking and fiberboard box to fall apart and fail once wet. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in plastic bag and hazmat tote and brought to hazmat cage .

DescribePack: HANDLE SIDE OF THE BOTTLE IS CRUSHED CAUSING CRACKING/SPLITTING ON THE SEAMS OF THE BOTTOM SIDE OF THE HANDLE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE UPRIGHTED AND PLACED IN TOTE.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Sequence of events unknown due to lack of communication from sort in which incident happened. DescribePack: Package failed due to cap on bottle within package coming off. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package mitigation consisted of putting box in an open contents bin and leaving it for OB QA to process.

item.title: Report X-2024021477
item.description:
Report X-2024021477

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-18
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat shipped as fully regulated found on HMPA staging pallet in lined tote with potent Hydrochloric Acid smell. Mishandling: OVH scan at NASH, 2/18 at 18:12. DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.1 gallon of fluid from a loose cap closure, despite caps being tamper-resistant. All four safety seals under cap closures failed to function; two remained stuck to the underside of caps and two were only partially attached to the bottle opening. No sign that internal corrosion was a factor. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation used and pH of liquid on outer packaging tested. Package placed in lined tote for transport to HMPA.
